page.title: 01General Description
page.content:
The block lies astride the{west} coast of Jersey, forming part of St Ouen's Bay with its fine stretch of sand extending some 5 km. end to end. A{tower}of Napoleonic times stands prominently in the middle of the bay at the low tide mark. The heavy Atlantic swell makes conditions ideal for{surfing activities}and the sands are used at low tide for a number of motor racing events.
The area over the{German antitank } {wall}is a broad strip of lowland dune sweeping up inland in the southwest to form a high dune area linked nearby to the well known{La Moye Golf course.
In the north,{farms}with light sandy soils nestle at the foot of the old cliff line. A{reservoir}lies in the extreme NE corner.
